duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and direct research in innovative power testing and analysis of generation, transmission, and distribution systems within the Critical Infrastructure Security & Resilience (CISR) mission.
Manage and lead all aspects of critical infrastructure-related projects within the Energy Systems portfolio.
Run and oversee all project milestones, scope, schedule, cost, and resources, and provide managerial leadership to the project team.
Mentor early to mid-career project managers and project coordinators, and contribute to the strategic vision and goals of Securing the Path to Net-Zero™.

Interface with various DOE offices and other industry stakeholders on infrastructure security-related collaborations and advise Program Manager on research opportunities in the area of security against threats to U.S. critical infrastructures.
Obtain and maintain a Department of Energy "Q" clearance, SCI access, and complete a polygraph, which requires US Citizenship.
Ensure alignment with relevant health and safety requirements, emergency action policies, and procedures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering and 8 years of relevant experience or Master's and 6 years or PhD and 4 years
